name: QRDoc
description:
The Patient Portal allows users to download a file using a QR code. Can you do a thorough security review on it?
We would really love to get our hands on AppSummaryBWayne.pdf :)

name: SSA-395458
description:
In August 2025, Siemens published an advisory for a vulnerability that was discovered by The S-Unit in the SAML marketplace module. Can you use it to take over dvanveen@the-s-unit.nl?

For convenience, you can find all the IDP metadata in the attachment :)

name: Blocked
description:
It seems like the developers of the patient portal have included a bit of a backdoor in case somebody forgets the admin password:
https://patientportal2025.mendixctf.com/ws-doc/

Unfortunately, it seems like access to the backdoor is blocked :(

We did some social engineering and managed to find out that the block is only IP based.

![path_restriction.png](resources/files/path_restriction.png)

![Restriction_profile.png](resources/files/Restriction_profile.png)

Surely there must be a way to get around something as simple as that :)

name: Patient Exporter II
description: Alright, you got some skills! That is not happening again though! Try to export ID 31337 again.

name: Banned-Aid II
description: Appreciate you tracking down my old doctor’s contact info! I gave him a call, but here’s the weird part: He doesn’t even know why he got banned. They just kicked him out one day, no explanation, cardboard box in hand. Something doesn’t add up... can you dig into the reason he got banned?

name: Banned-Aid I
description: I've had the same two doctors for the last decade and suddenly one is gone from the website! Sure, he had shady advertising, botched surgeries, and overprescribed, but... You know? I might have an idea about why he is gone. Still, it would be nice to give them a call now and then.

name: No Accessible Vector

hints.text: Find out which pages are available for your user by inspecting /xas/ requests
Try opening an interesting-looking page via the console
If you don't know how, try using mx.ui.openForm2()

description: Another day, another tester leaking something they shouldn't. You have no chance navigating your way to the flag though: It is simply not visible for you!

name: Patient Exporter I
description: The Patient Portal has a new API that allows for the exporting of patient data. If you can export patient ID 31337, then I'll give you a flag.

name: Refill Overkill
description: I forgot where I put my medication that helps with my memory loss. I should increase my monthly dose... Unfortunately, the website only allows an increase with doctor approval. What was their name again? Could you help me out to find another way?

name: Site Unseen
description: Sometimes websites contain more than you might expect. Developers create functionalities they used for testing, but forget to remove it when the website goes into production. Can you find the hidden features to spot the hidden flag?

name: Restless Hackers
description: I can’t eat… I can’t sleep… all I do is think about the next flag! I need something to calm my nerves and finally get some rest. Luckily, the patient portal has a new REST API that exposes public information about available medications. Can you help me find something to settle my nerves?

name: Fiscal Life Support
description: The hospital has been under financial strain for years... Can you discover the details of the new budget?

name: Work My Complaint Flow
description: With all these complaints, we will need to hire someone to handle them all properly!

name: Back to the Pizza 2
description: Dear Marty, If my calculations are correct, you will receive this letter immediately after you’ve placed an order at the pizza shop. I'm desperate for pizza. You know where I am, and remember: do not forget to think four-dimensionally in UTC! — Doc Emmett L. Brown

name: Baker's secret recipe!
description: Hmm, the admin hasn't checked that secret baker's hash brownie recipe, or has he?

name: 88 miles per hour
description: Get Marty and Doc to deliver your order by messing with time!

name: Been there...
description: A glas is nothing without a good pole supporting it, a hacker might need some support breaking it!

name: Baker's delight!

hints.text: What happens when people forget their passwords?
Look for common password recovery mechanisms.
Sometimes the simplest solutions are built right into the application.

description: Oops. It seems some of our bakers might have lost their password...

name: eman ruoy esreveR
description: ,eman eht rettam on ,yletilop uoy teerg I .emas eht tca t’now I dna dnuora em pilf tuB ,thgis nialp ni eulc a sedih klaw uoy taht htap ehT .thgil eht ees noos ll’uoy ,yrrac uoy tahw trevnI ,garb ll’I terces ym ,yltcerroc em llaC .galf thguos-gnol ruoy dnif lliw uoy ereht dnA

name: Jan pays!
description: Jan is the master of the community, by connecting the dots he might even pay your pizza.

name: AI will generate that for me
description: Documentation is key, but given that I am lazy and our integrations are easy I will let my AI friend generate that.

name: I know better
description: Pizzas are expensive, time to save some money by setting my own prices.

name: Hiding in plain sight

hints.text: Where do you use your password?

description: Password managers are for the nerds, I will just write mine down where I need it.

name: Pizza Complaint
description: People are so ungrateful these days, complaining about every minor issue.

name: AI is my personal translator
description: Translating is such a tedious job, but Mendix has a nice feature for that, so AI will do my translations.

name: Cashcow!
description: Spending big on gifts is what I do, limits are not my problem!

name: Gifts for me
description: Nobody ever gifts me anything, if you want something you will need to take care of it!
